New Records: At the age of just 16 years and 353 days, Barcelona prodigy Lamine Yamal became the youngest-ever player to feature in the knockout rounds of a European Championship when he started and registered an assist in Spain's 4-1 comeback victory over Georgia in the last 16.
Key Match Events: Spain won 2-1 against Germany in the Euro 2024 quarter-final match held on July 5, 2024, at the Mercedes-Benz-Arena.
Goals were scored by Dani Olmo (51') and Mikel Merino (119') for Spain, and Florian Wirtz (89') for Germany.

Several players received yellow cards during the match, including Le Normand (29'), Torres (74'), Simon (82'), Carvajal (100'), Rodri (110'), Ruiz (120') for Spain, and Rudiger (13'), Raum (28'), Andrich (56'), Kroos (67'), Mittelstadt (73'), Schlotterbeck (89'), Wirtz (94'), Undav (113') for Germany.
Dani Carvajal received a red card at 120+6'.
Pre-Game Insights: Spain boss Luis de la Fuente is expected to name an unchanged starting lineup for the Euro 2024 quarter-final match against Germany.
Lamine Yamal is set to continue in attack and could become the youngest-ever goalscorer in Euros history if he scores in the match.
Spain's possible starting lineup includes Simon; Carvajal, Le Normand, Laporte, Cucurella; Pedri, Rodri, Ruiz; Yamal, Morata, Williams.
